Zhe Chen
Zhe Chen ( Simplified Chinese: 陈哲; pinyin: Chén Zhé; birthday: April 4, 1981) is a Chinese computer science researcher. He was born in
Hengyang ,
Hunan , China.
Career
Education
Zhe Chen graduated with a B.S. degree in computer science and Master degree in Pattern Recognition and Intelligent System from
Central South University in 2003 and 2006 respectively, and went on to earn a Ph.D. in computer science from Institut National des Sciences Appliquées de Toulouse, France.
Academic research
At
Central South University , Chen worked on topics in Natural Language Processing and Question Answering. In 2006, he joined Natural Language Computing Group of
Microsoft Research Asia
, where he worked on topics in Automatic Evaluation Algorithms for Search Engines. Then he spent one year in
Shanghai Jiao Tong University working in Theoretical computer science, including CCS, Pi-Calculus and Logic in Computer Science. In 2007, he went on to earn a Ph.D. in computer science from Institut National des Sciences Appliquées de Toulouse, where he worked on topics in Dependable Computing System, Programming Language and Logic in Computer Science.
Publications
Zhe Chen, Dunwei Wen, "Accelerating and Evaluation of Syntactic Parsing in Natural Language Question Answering Systems", Proceedings of International Conference on Artificial Intelligence (ICAI 2007), June 25-28, Las Vegas, Nevada, USA, 2007.
Zhe Chen, Chin-Yew Lin, Jian-Tao Sun, "Iterative Voting Algorithm: A New Automatic Evaluation Method for Web Search Engines", Technical Report, Microsoft Research Asia, August 2006.
Zhe Chen, Dunwei Wen, " A New Web-service-based Architecture for Question Answering", Proceedings of IEEE International Conference on Natural Language Processing and Knowledge Engineering, pp.179-183, Oct. 2005.
Zhe Chen, Dunwei Wen, "Study and Implementation of Improving Question Answering Systems Using NLP", Computer Engineering, Vol.32(No.20), 205-206, Oct. 2006. (in Chinese) ''
